SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

be.docarch.odt2braille.addon
Class UnoGUI

java.lang.Object
  be.docarch.odt2braille.addon.UnoGUI

public class UnoGUI
extends java.lang.Object

The changeSettings, exportBraille and embossBraille methods roughly correspond with the three main tasks that be called from the 'Braille' menu. The main control flow of these tasks is found here.

Author:
Bert Frees

Configure logger and locale.

Method Detail

initialise

private void initialise()
The OpenOffice.org Writer document is exported as an .odt file and converted to a "flat XML" .odt file (a single file that is the concatenation of all XML files in a normal .odt file).

changeSettings

public boolean changeSettings()
Overwrite the default settings with settings loaded from the OpenOffice.org Writer document, execute the "Braille Settings" dialog that enables users to change these settings and store the new settings if the user confirms.

Returns:
true if the new settings were succesfully saved.

exportBraille

public boolean exportBraille()
Export the document as a generic or embosser-specific braille file.
  • First, changeSettings is called.
  • A newly created Checker checks the settings and the flat .odt file, and if necessary, a first warning box with possible accessibility issues is shown.
  • The user selects the location of the output file in a "Save as" dialog.
  • The document is converted to a temporary .pef file.
  • If necessary, a second warning box with possible accessibility issues is shown.
  • The .pef file is converted to the specified output format and stored at its final location.

Returns:
true if the document is succesfully exported to a braille file, false if the user aborts the process at any time.

embossBraille

public boolean embossBraille()
Print the document on a braille embosser.
  • First, changeSettings is called.
  • A newly created Checker checks the settings and the flat .odt file, and if necessary, a first warning box with possible accessibility issues is shown.
  • Either the "Emboss" dialog or the "Emboss on Interpoint 55" is shown, depending on the selected embosser type.
  • The document is converted to a temporary .pef file.
  • If necessary, a second warning box with possible accessibility issues is shown.
  • If the "Interpoint 55" was selected, the .pef file is converted to a .brf file that can be interpreted by the wprint55 program, and wprint55 is executed. Otherwise, the .pef file is converted to the appropriate embosser-specific braille format and send to the specified printer device.

Returns:
true if the document is succesfully printed on a braille embosser, false if the user aborts the process at any time.

sixKeyEntryMode

public boolean sixKeyEntryMode()

insertBraille

public boolean insertBraille()

handleUnexpectedException

private void handleUnexpectedException(java.lang.Exception ex)
Handling of an unexpected exception. A message box is shown with a reference to the log file.

Parameters:
ex - The exception

clean

public void clean()
Flush and close the logfile handler.
